page.title: 15Gt. Bromley:the Post Office
page.content: One of the oldest buildings in Great Bromley is the old Post Office.It is {400 years old}.The first person to run the Post Office was a farmer between 1855 & 1863.In 1878 the Post Office also became the local shop.It stayed in the{same family}until 1948.the present owner was Postmaster until five years ago when he retired. He worked from 7:00a.m.to 7:00p.m during the week,but on saturday,he closed at 1:00p.m.The Post Office dealt with pensions,allowances,letters and parcels,as well as licences for dogs,guns and{C.B.licences}(=Citizen's Band radio ).His first Postmistress delivered letters etc.by{bike}on a{38} {mile route}. The Post Office has now been moved to a new purpose-built site just up the road from the old,cottage Post Office.
